result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A. Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVEIW hearing December 11, 2015 at 1:15 p.m. in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as ordered.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the  Court or agent has approved a modification to No Violent contact.
No firearms.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continued programming.
Successfully complete any other counselng and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Particiapte in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A. Morgan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon A. Morgan in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Brandon A. Morgan in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 16 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 16 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court or agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court ordered defendant allowed 4 hours per day, Monday through Friday, for work search.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Brandon A. Morgan in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

15RM032262  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-03-15
Plea date scheduled for 08-14-2015 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO JusticePoint for supervision with the Pretrial Electronic Monitoring Program.  Drug testing, Breathalyzer tests, Absolute Sobriety, No drugs without a valid prescription, No Contact with the victim, release for employment.  No weapons/No firearms
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will amend bail conditions.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Brandon A. Morgan not in court, in custody.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing and requests adjournment for plea hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.

Defendant's Motion For Bail Reduction received and filed.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Brandon A. Morgan not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense, per the State.  Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Heather D; Angel S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon A. Morgan in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Brandon A. Morgan in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, branch 4. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  

IF RELEASES FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
